target_content: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction sub-theme because it specifically mentions emission reductions in various sectors, which is a key aspect of reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The target is also related to the ETS2, which is a mechanism for reducing emissions.

target_content: ETS2. Contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42% emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005
justification: This target is assigned to the GHG Reduction - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically mentions the buildings sector as one of the areas where emission reductions are expected.

target_content: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple (rate is currently at 1.5%)
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy - Heating & Cooling sub-theme because it specifically mentions solar heat and geothermal energy, which are types of renewable energy used for heating and cooling.

target_content: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple (rate is currently at 1.5%)
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it mentions a specific type of renewable energy (solar heat and geothermal) and sets a target for increasing its use.

target_content: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union’s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42.5%.
justification: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it sets a specific target for the share of renewable energy in the EU's energy consumption.

target_content: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings (of buildings which have a total useful floor area of over 250 m2 and are not nearly-zero energy buildings) that are owned by public bodies is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings or zero-emission buildings in accordance with Article 9 of Directive 2010/31/EU.
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it specifically mentions the renovation of buildings to improve their energy efficiency.

target_content: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030 and to foster deep energy renovations.
justification: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency - Buildings sub-theme because it mentions increasing the energy renovation rate of buildings, which is a key aspect of improving energy efficiency.

target_content: By 2030, Union recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, should be able of producing at least 25% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials and should be able of recycling significantly increasing amounts of each strategic raw material from waste.
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it specifically mentions recycling strategic raw materials, which includes critical materials used in batteries.

target_content: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 75% by average weight of lead-acid batteries, - 80% by average weight of nickel-cadmium batteries - 50% by average weight of other waste batteries No later than 31 December 2030 - 80% by average weight of lead-acid batteries,
thematic_area: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
sub_theme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
justification: This target is assigned to the Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling sub-theme because it specifically mentions recycling efficiency targets for different types of batteries.

target_content: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030.
justification: This target is assigned to the Transport Logistics sub-theme because it mentions reducing fuel intensity in the fisheries sector, which is a type of transportation.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them offering a power output of at least 600kW and including at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.
justification: This target is assigned to the Net-Zero Technology - Road Vehicles sub-theme because it specifically mentions recharging pools for light-duty vehicles, which is a key aspect of transitioning to net-zero emissions in the road transport sector.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed, provided by recharging stations with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.
justification: This target is assigned to the Net-Zero Technology - Road Vehicles sub-theme because it specifically mentions recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles, which is a key aspect of transitioning to net-zero emissions in the road transport sector.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025, at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T comprehensive inland waterway ports by 1 January 2030.
justification: This target is assigned to the Net-Zero Technology - Maritime Transport sub-theme because it specifically mentions shore-side electricity supply for inland waterway vessels, which is a key aspect of transitioning to net-zero emissions in the maritime transport sector.

target_content: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the Pesticides Reduction sub-theme because it specifically mentions reducing the use of more hazardous pesticides, which is a key aspect of reducing the environmental impact of agriculture.

target_content: Genetic biodiversity of food production systems: Secure and ensure access to a range of quality seeds for plant varieties in order to adapt to the pressures of climate change.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the Biodiversity conservation sub-theme because it specifically mentions genetic biodiversity in food production systems, which is a key aspect of conserving biodiversity.

target_content: Income distribution: Ensure fair income and salaries. Improve income of primary producers to ensure their sustainable livelihood.
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the Competitive Agriculture sub-theme because it specifically mentions improving the income of primary producers, which is a key aspect of ensuring the competitiveness of the agricultural sector.

target_content: Digitalisation and knowledge transfer. Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas to achieve the objective of 100% access by 2025
thematic_area: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
justification: This target is assigned to the Food quality - Healthy Food sub-theme because it specifically mentions ensuring access to fast broadband, which can help improve the quality of food production by providing farmers with access to information and technology.

target_content: (forest ecosystems) Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of the common forest bird index, as further set out in Annex VI, measured in the period from the date of entry into force of this Regulation until 31 December 2030, and every six years thereafter, until the satisfactory levels identified in accordance with Article 11(3) are reached
justification: This target is assigned to the Terrestrial Ecosystems Restoration - Forests sub-theme because it specifically mentions the common forest bird index, which is an indicator of the health of forest ecosystems.

target_content: Improve water quality by reducing microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the Improve Water Quality sub-theme because it specifically mentions reducing microplastics released into the environment, which is a key aspect of improving water quality.

target_content: Improve water quality by reducing microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
thematic_area: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
justification: This target is assigned to the Microplastics sub-theme because it specifically mentions reducing microplastics, which is a key aspect of improving water quality.
